programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giless Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: A look at the first round of testing for shuttle drivers, which has a 90 per cent fail rate, while supercars arrive in convoy for the Le Mans 24-hour race

programme.title: Stolen: Catching the Art Thieves
programme.desc: Documentary featuring first-hand accounts of Europes most daring art heists, beginning with the theft of JMW Turners Shade and Darkness and Light and Colour in 1994 from the Schirn gallery in Frankfurt. The paintings were on loan from the Londons Tate and the invetsigation into the heist led to a high-stakes game of cat and mouse across Europe, from London to Belgrade deep into the world of Serbian warlords

programme.title: Call My Bluff
programme.desc: Robert Robinson presides over a duel of words and wits between Frank Muir, Jilly Cooper and Quentin Bell and Patrick Campbell, Lesley-Anne Down and Anthony Valentine. First broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Face the Music
programme.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against panellists Patricia Owen, John Julius Norwich and David Attenborough. With guest musician Imogen Cooper. First broadcast in 1975

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Ian Holm narrates a 1983 profile of the Hollywood star, spanning her life and career from the 1920s to the 1980s, on stage and on screen, and including an interview with Davis herself

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Documentary charting jazz musician George Mellys visit to the Hayward Gallery in 1978, where he examines the works on show in a major exhibition on Dada and surrealism. He also talks to some of the last English followers of the movement, including Roland Penrose, before meeting up with rock band the Stranglers

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee and guest Bernard Williams discuss the work of French philosopher Rene Descartes

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Anthony Lord Quinton to discusses the work of Dutch philosopher Baruch Spinoza and German philosopher Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside

The paintings were on loan from the Londons Tate and the invetsigation into the heist led to a high-stakes game of cat and mouse across Europe, from London to Belgrade deep into the world of Serbian warlords

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: A year in the life of Bodnant Garden in north Wales. With visitor numbers in decline, head gardener Troy Scott Smith and his manager Michael McLaren are spending £2million on a revamp, with the aim of creating one of the top 10 gardens in the world

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: The English actress and singer reflects on the sitcom, recalling how the character of Hyacinth Bucket first entered her life, while looking back on the part she played in bringing to life one of televisions most formidable comedy characters. She describes the pleasure of working with her fellow cast members and how, despite her fondness of the programme, she finally decided to call time on the show

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Miss Pyms Day Out
programme.desc: Patricia speaks about working on the RTS award-winning episode of the Bookmark series, in which she portrayed author Barbara Pym on the day of the 1977 Booker Prize awards. The actress shares what it was like to tell this story, from the encounters with Pyms family that were involved in the project, to reading the diary entries and letters included in the script

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Dame Patricia Routledge Remembers - Talking Heads
programme.desc: The actress reflects upon her roles in Alan Bennetts acclaimed series of one-off teleplays Talking Heads. She recalls what it was like to receive the scripts that were so perfectly suited to her comic abilities, and Patricia describes the challenges of bringing the characters to life

programme.title: Talking Heads
programme.desc: A woman acting as a self-appointed Neighbourhood Watch scheme finds her habit of writing letters to the authorities is getting ridiculously out of hand. Alan Bennetts comic monologue, performed by Patricia Routledge

programme.title: Wild
programme.desc: The rich natural habitat of Bardsey Island, which lies off the Llyn peninsula, north Wales. Exploring the variety of wildlife to which it is home, particularly the thousands of unusual nocturnal birds that thrive on its environment

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: A look at a Soviet-era sanatorium on the shores of Odesa, Ukraine, where thousands arrive each summer in search of healing. Following a cast of patients and staff navigating daily life under the shadow of conflict, while they search for love, healing and happiness amidst the ongoing war close by

programme.title: Blood and Gold: The Making of Spain with Simon Sebag Montefiore
programme.desc: The historian examines Spains Golden Age under Philip II through to the Spanish Civil War and dictatorship under Franco, from which Spain has emerged as a modern democratic monarchy

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: A year in the life of Bodnant Garden in north Wales. With visitor numbers in decline, head gardener Troy Scott Smith and his manager Michael McLaren are spending £2million on a revamp, with the aim of creating one of the top 10 gardens in the world

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Richard is forced to think on his feet when he forgets his wedding anniversary and tells Hyacinth he has arranged to have a security alarm fitted as a present. Social-climbing comedy, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Bookmark
programme.desc: Imaginative re-creation of the day in 1977 when novelist Barbara Pym travelled to London to attend the Booker Prize ceremony. Starring Patricia Routledge, with appearances from Jilly Cooper, Penelope Lively, Hilary Pym, Hazel Holt, Henry Harvey, Tom Maschler and more. First broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Appealing to both adults and children alike, Philip Pullmans books have sold more than 20 million copies and been translated into 40 languages, with his recent novel La Belle Sauvage becoming an instant best-seller. Alan Yentob spends time with the author in Oxford, discovering how the former teacher became an acclaimed writer of fantasy fiction - and an outspoken critic of organised religion

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Louise Minchin present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: How 21-year-old cadet Daniel Khalife broke out of Wandsworth Prison, provoking the largest manhunt in recent UK history

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin looks at a down-at-heel 1930s Nottingham bungalow thats been transformed into a modern, stylish house. Martel Maxwell and Jacqui Joseph report on developers in Workington, in Cumbria, and Gillingham, in Kent, as they work wonders on their auction buys

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents as two teams are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction in Heanor, Derbyshire. Best friends Lindsay and Joy on the red team, guided by Irita Marriott, are on the lookout for pottery, jewellery and gardenalia. Friends Hilary and Siobhan on the blue team, assisted by John Cameron, are hoping their enthusiasm and passion for antiques will help them win

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Vehicle recovery specialist Richard is on the trail of a caravan thats been stolen during a late-night raid on a site in Nottingham. Tracker Joe hunts down a stolen Range Rover thats being dismantled for parts in a workshop

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: A couple search around Helvellyn for their toy Gonzo, a character from the TV sketch comedy The Muppet Show - which they have cherished as a beloved mascot for 50 years. After a damaged phone is found underwater, experts pull out all the stops to track down its owner. A local crafter makes a keepsake out of discarded items. Presented by Helen Skelton

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to the Cumbrian countryside with a sporty couple chasing a fresh start, with plans for a carpentry business and plenty of outdoor adventures

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts restore an elephant puppet that survived a fire and is believed to have been part of the early BBC childrens programme Muffin the Mule, a Swiss timepiece that belonged to a Lancaster bomber pilot in the Second World War, a sign showing a lap record time from a race track in Scarborough and a hurling stick from the 1980s

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, anything between zero and £4,000. Each player only knows their own value before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve, and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Trevor Nelson

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel prepares to sell his beloved car, but accidentally damages it in the process. Later he makes a reckless decision that has serious consequences. George grows concerned about Kojos whereabouts, and Kat is consumed with worry for her family

programme.title: Panorama
programme.sub-title: The Race to Build 1.5 Million Homes
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Justin Rowlatt travel from South Tyneside to the Isle of Wight to find out if the Governments promise of building 1.5 million new homes in England by 2029 is practicable and if it will make housing more affordable. Along the way they discover the secret to making bricks, explore the complexity of the planning system and meet the new housing secretary

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace offers up a secret about her own past in an attempt to connect to Lindsay. Aislings erratic behaviour forces Tommy to make a heartbreaking decision

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts, with guest panellists comedian Ross Noble and journalist Helen Lewis joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop. As usual, all concerned poke fun at the weeks headlines

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabena pulls out all the stops with an elaborate date to win Vanessa back, determined to remind her of what they once shared, and as they reminisce, old feelings resurface. Maurice and Funmis romantic night out falls apart when they cant find a babysitter, forcing them to improvise at home - quietly, cautiously, and with one ear on the baby monitor. Over dinner, Errol finally works up the courage to ask Grace a big question - until Claude and Polly swoop in and ruin the mood. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When network executive Pippa makes a surprise visit to the set of Sin and Subterfuge, Kwabena knows its his chance to prove he belongs in the directors chair. A flawless day could launch his career, but as one mishap spirals into another, he must rely on his charm and determination to keep the production afloat - and his dream within reach. When Maurice misses yet another nursery event for Mayowa, Funmi finds an unexpected ally in a fellow parent. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: When the long-awaited chance to direct Jamaica Road finally arrives, Kwabena faces one final obstacle - he needs Simons help. Needless to say, getting his support comes with big strings attached. A run-in with Vanessa and her new boyfriend hits Kwabena like a ton of bricks. Maurice is blindsided when he learns that Mayowa has a girlfriend - something he knew nothing about. The revelation stings, forcing him to ask if the sacrifices hes making to fund his sons future are costing him the present. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Gordon Smart present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Steph McGovern reveal how a thief who killed a delivery driver in the process of trying to steal his van was eventually caught. The police also need help with another murder.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A young developer in Bushey Heath, Hertfordshire follows his mothers advice while working on a ground floor flat and an estate agent in blown away by a house in Pontypool, Monmouthshire. Two friends turn a healthy profit from transforming a terraced house in Croydon, south London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross visits the Royal Armouries Museum in Leeds to see a collection of human, horse and elephant armour, while Izzie Balmer and David Harper assist the teams in Wetherby, West Yorkshire

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Vehicle recovery specialist Richard tracks expensive farmyard vehicles stolen in broad daylight. He traces them to a scrapyard, but as he arrives, theyre on the move again

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team searches for two lost pieces of jewellery with sentimental value and crafter Lucy Wright tries to turn a discarded ceramic pot into treasure. Social media detective Mui Abdul sends the team on the hunt for a missing teddy bear

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple find a new home in Warwickshire after six years living in the USA and now missing the UK. Jules also visits an 18th century walled garden to meet the volunteers who help keep it in tip-top condition

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts restore a carved wooden village sign made for the millennium, a handmade organ crafted from cardboard during the First World War, a rusted-up shop till that hasnt been used since the 1970s and cinema seats from the 1940s

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson for the quiz where contestants try to score as few points as possible. As ever, players attempt to come up with the answers no one else could think of on subjects including crime fiction, racing drivers and bells

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: After an odd text from Harrys phone, Teddy shares his worries with Billy. Meanwhile, Okie is fuming at Harry and insists he calls Kojo to tell him to return to the handlers. Nigel reels from his actions, Kat makes a worrying discovery, and Johnny considers a new business venture

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: The documentary offers an insight into the work of frontline staff in Yorkshire. It promises to be a busy night in Bradford as the citys large Muslim community prepares to celebrate Eid. Call handler Ellie is on her final night shift before beginning her training to join the ambulance crews on the road - and before long she is guiding a worried husband through his wifes labour on the other end of the phone. Phoebe and Bailey are dispatched to Ann, who is suspected to have broken her hip in a fall after a few drinks ahead of her 80th birthday

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.sub-title: Syria to Omagh: Lost and Missing - Spotlight
programme.desc: Now living in Omagh, Emad Al Rawashda cannot rest until he finds his missing daughter, son and grandchildren - all vanished while trying to flee from the Middle East. Backing him is a friend who has also experienced loss - Michael Gallagher, whose son was killed in the Omagh bombing. Jennifer OLeary joins Emads search from Tyrone to his shattered home place in Syria

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Frederick Forsyth
programme.desc: The late thriller writer reflects on his life and tells stories of how he became the youngest ever RAF pilot, a Reuters foreign correspondent, a BBC reporter and an MI6 informant. He also shares what happened to inspire his first novel The Day of the Jackal and what it was like to become a millionaire almost overnight

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: Evie retreats to the safety of the garage, but with a new understanding, Suz and Izzie create a unique version of Film Club to bring back Evies smile

programme.title: Film Club
programme.desc: The day has finally come for Noa to leave, but Evie might not let him go that easily and it is not the only big decision she has to face

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Montell Douglas, Owain Wyn Evans, Sarah Greene, Danielle Harold, Colin Jackson and Matt Morsia take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win big. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: An offbeat look at the hideous history of health, from the invention of toilet paper to the healthy origins of the cornflake. Plus, how the Mayans believed that drinking urine could cure all ills, how the Tudors taught themselves how to swim again, how Victorians had a taste in beauty products that was literally shocking, and an in-depth look at Louis XIVs bottom problems

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: How the worlds deadliest dynasties came to power

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: P Diddy: The Rise and Fall
programme.desc: Yinka Bokinni investigates how Sean Combs has gone from being the worlds biggest hip-hop mogul to haemorrhaging money, businesses, friends and fans in a matter of months. Yinka will examine how Combs made it to the top, and what some may have turned a blind eye to along the way. Speaking to some of Combs inner circle, and biggest critics, Yinka will find out what they think about him and ask why so many are only speaking out now

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: The couples receive a visit from their loved ones as they weigh up their connections and prepare to decide whether to continue their relationships off the island

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: The castaways reunite for one final Couples Cove, for those who found a happy ending its a chance to spread love but for those who left with a broken heart, its the final opportunity to resolve unfinished business

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon as a British-Jamaican film-maker facing the day-to-day struggles of being an independent creative trying to survive in London. Kwabena searches for his first directing job, but only finds scripts built on tired black stereotypes. With time running out, he considers whether to take any job or hold out for integrity. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon, Dani Moseley and Demmy Ladipo

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. What at first feels like a dream project soon raises unsettling questions and Kwabena tries to find a solution. A spark with talented actress comes at the worst possible time when an old flame resurfaces. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. Determined to support the veteran performer, his good intentions are tested by the relentless demands of the shoot. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. Maurice and Funmi are called in by the nursery after an altercation between Mayowa and another child, but are surprised to find things arent as they first assumed. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Schoolgirl Steph stands up for her right to learn the whole truth about sex, and challenges the status quo of sex education in the UK

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: With less than a week to go, the couples are contemplating their relationships on the outside, where the distractions of everyday life will all come back into play

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From singing poos to tuneful Warlords, there is something for all musical tastes and Rattus has somehow also roped Brad from the Vamps in to help him out, although rather than playing live on the main stage, Brads role seems to be more about unblocking the toilets just behind it.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Swill Gumbitz takes a look at Greek statues, the musical instrument that could make you poo yourself, and the evolution of bottom-wiping

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: In an episode originally shown in 2011, Jeremy Clarkson celebrates the 50th anniversary of the Jaguar E-type by driving a modern-day interpretation of the classic sports car, and throws a typically low-key party involving live music, fighter planes and the Royal Marines. Richard Hammond is in South Africa, where he tests the Marauder, a bigger, more rugged alternative to the Humvee, and James May enlists the help of 2010 Winter Olympic skeleton gold medallist Amy Williams and former Intercontinental Rally Challenge champion Kris Meeke to try out a Mini rally car. Plus, the Stig takes the BMW 1 Series M Coupe around the test track and Alice Cooper gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Exhausted, Georgie is looking forward to returning home to her fiance Jamie and her family, but the forces need her help first. However, she is shocked to the core when a desperate Elvis is forced to come clean. Starring Michelle Keegan and Luke Pasqualino

programme.title: Waves
programme.desc: High-school student Tyler Williams is a star athlete on the wrestling team thanks to relentless training and sparring with his domineering father, Ronald. Those dreams of excellence are threatened by Tylers shoulder injury, which he secretly deals with using prescription painkillers. Events spiral out of control when Tylers girlfriend, Alexis, learns she is pregnant and the young couple run a gauntlet of angry protesters outside an abortion clinic. Writer/director Trey Edward Shults award winning drama, starring Kelvin Harrison Jr, Lucas Hedges and Taylor Russell

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The ultimate hunt for the best new British comic begins as 30 hopefuls battle it out across six heats to earn a place at the Final, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Josh Jones hosts the West heat at St Georges, a multi-purpose, fully accessible live music and arts venue in the heart of Bristol. Carwyn Blayney, Will Owen, Omari Douglas, Jess Carrivick and Alfie Dundas take to the stage in a bid to impress judges Priya Hall, Harriet Dyer and Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.sub-title: Fly, Chase, Fly/Get the Egg Home

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: The Rollinator/The Art of Friendship/What a Stinker/Compost to Go
programme.desc: Chep is so good at moss-marbles, no one wants to play him anymore! programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Let It Bee/The Staff Of Wisdom/The Snake Dance/Grasshopper Chep
programme.desc: Wanting to rush off to climb Mush Mountain, Mush-Mush is in a hurry checking nectar level in flowers – a job that takes time and care. / Mush-Mush is amazed by the way Mushpot uses his staff of wisdom and how awesome it makes him look. / When Mush-Mush and Chep lose Lilit’s flying disc down a snake tunnel, he is confident he can get it back. / All the Mushables have fun zooming down a long mudslide except Chep, who just cant get up the courage to do it.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Mushlers to the Rescue/Shine, Lilit, Shine/Eyes on the Surprise/The Show Mush Go On
programme.desc: Having rescued a Mushlet, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit becomes heroes in Mushton, and they’re loving it! / The Beacon Mushroom that guides the Mushables back to Mushton in the dark has gone out. / Every time Mush-Mush has tried to surprise his friend with a gift, Chep has always found out what it was. But Chep promises that this time he won’t. / Mushpie loves to sing. Only problem she is terrible at it!

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: A Frog Of A Problem/Fool The Forest/Mushroomates/Race The Beast/Surprise, Its Spring/The Missing Mushlet
programme.desc: Mush-Mush’s favourite frog has had its home taken over by a lizard. Mushpot says not to interfere – nature will balance itself out. / It’s Fool the Forest Day! Mushables pull pranks all over Mushton, and Mush-Mush has an epic one planned. / When ants invade Fung and Miff’s tree, our Mushlers offer for them to move in… but the two quickly turn out to be unbearable roommates. / Mush-Mush and his friends are determined to win the bark sledge race, but their essential fourth team member drops out. / Puff doesn’t like change much. And with spring about to burst forth and all the changes spring brings, he is puffing out nervous fog which is blanketing the whole of Mushton. / So Mushpie can take a break, Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit offer to look after the Mushies, assuring her that everything will be fine.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.sub-title: Bear Fractions/The Bear That Laid Golden...
programme.desc: ...Eggs/Crash Training Course/As Far as Bear Can Remember/Chemical Lemmings/Remote Control/The Bear and the Butterfly/Get Off My Tennis Shoes/Babysitting => The Lemmings inherit a crate that fell off an army convoy. / The Lemmings want to get their hands on a firework rocket. / Grizzy finds a high-tech gadget that enables you to learn anything within seconds. He can now become the perfect bear! / An old metal box found by chance in a recess of a cliff brings back childhood memories for Grizzy and the Lemmings. / How can one peacefully watch a documentary on salmon, nice and comfy on the sofa, when the Lemmings are playing chemistry with a fun experiment box? / Grizzys TV remote is stolen and stored high up in a tree. / Grizzy wants to offer a butterfly to his beloved she bear. / The Lemmings have discovered an addictive new game based on the astonishing bouncing properties of the rangers new running shoes. / Grizzy babysits for the she-bear he has a crush on. Theres no question of Grizzy tripping up, for he has no intention of taking any risks!

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables

Mush-Mush is sure he predicted it! / Everyone in Mushton is finding that their precious wooden things are being munched and destroyed by someone or something. / If Mush-Mush had Bolly’s speed, he’d want everyone to see just how awesomely fast he was. / Chep becomes obsessed with learning all about Mushlore – all the funny little traditions and things that Mushables believe in.

programme.title: Mush-Mush and the Mushables
programme.sub-title: Run, Mushpie, Run/Puffs Perfect Picnic/Good Vibrations/Getting Truffy With It
programme.desc: Mush-Mush, Chep and Lilit notice that Mushpie seems in great shape lately. They want to feel as great as she does and try to discover her secret. / Because he has won the moss-ball game last year, Puff is in charge of organizing this Summer’s Picnic. Only Puff isn’t comfortable in that role. / Lilit is under pressure. Truff, the most talented musician in Mushton, has invited her, Mush-Mush and Chep to form a band with him. / Truff is happy. He has found a necklace that makes him even Truffier! Except he had no idea the necklace belongs to Starmush.

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Millions of workers in the UK could lose their jobs because of the artificial intelligence revolution. According to experts the impact on a range of industries could be dramatic, with skilled work particularly affected. As AI develops rapidly, with claims it can outperform humans in most tasks, Dispatches undertakes a bold and unique experiment that pitches human against machine to find out how true that is. Four professionals are invited into a specially-created test centre to compete in a set of identical tasks against their AI counterparts: a GP; a fashion photographer; a trainee solicitor; and a composer. With reputations as well as jobs at stake, who comes out on top - humans or AI?

programme.title: Dogs Behaving (Very) Badly: Australia
programme.desc: Dog trainer Graeme Hall helps owners with dog troubles in Australia. In Melbourne, he meets old English sheepdog Angus, whose job as a model is in danger due to his habit of loudly objecting whenever someone tries to snap a picture of him. Theres also a Hoover-hungry dachshund who barks, bites and besieges cleaning appliances, making any housework for owner Jenny a real chore

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Shona Searson prepares for her wedding, which is due to take place in her garden, surrounded by her sheep, goats and dogs. After a night-time emergency call to help a pregnant cow give birth, she goes from wellies and waterproofs to a wedding dress fitting. At the practice in Wetherby, Julian Norton has to operate to remove a worrying tumour from a pug, while Peter Wright rushes to the birth of a donkey at the Greens farm

programme.title: Murder Before Evensong
programme.desc: Audrey encourages Daniel to question Champtons gamekeeper, Edgy, whom Stella witnessed near Anthonys murder site. However, Daniel thinks that Anthonys research might have a bearing on his death. Church organist Jane turns to Daniel with a dilemma when she realises her husband may have had a motive to kill. Kath is upset to find her cancer-stricken sister, Dora, has accidentally damaged their house

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: PCs Hayes and Fox are called to a suspected fight, but not all is at it seems and they end up trying to get to the bottom of an alleged drug deal gone wrong. Officers Wells and Bace deal with a lovers spat spinning out of control and need to decide the best course of action to protect everyone, but its not going to go down very well with either partner

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: On the A1, officers battle to stop a dangerous driver from careering down the carriageway in 18 tons of stolen lorry. After a successful strike with a heavy-duty stinger, the driver carries on until he runs out of road and takes his chances on foot. but he crosses the path of two security dogs on duty with their handler. Meanwhile, in Sutton-in-Ashfield, firearms cops Richard and Ash are forced to use the big red key when a wanted man refuses to open the door, and over in Hucknall, the results of a roadworthy check dont go down too well.

programme.title: Ice Age: Frozen World
programme.desc: Naturalist and explorer Steve Backshall and wildlife presenter Michaela Strachan reveal the hidden secrets of the Ice Age, using state of the art technology to bring this frozen world to life. In the first episode, the duo witness the rise of giant beasts such as the woolly mammoth and sabre-toothed tiger, revealing how they were perfectly adapted for this extreme environment, and what factors let to their extinction. Later, Michaela travels deep into the Arctic Circle to try and solve the puzzle of how and why the Ice Age started in the first place

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarellas in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leones in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Secret Army
programme.desc: Lifeline is ordered to protect a senior army officer who could potentially reveal top-secret military information about Allied plans for a Middle East offensive

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter captures young killer Billy John, but his real motive is not the cash reward - he has an old score to settle with his prisoners brother Frank. As the journey to bring the murderer to justice gets under way, he is counting on a showdown with Frank and accepts the help of two outlaw gunmen for added protection, aware they will try to turn Billy John in themselves for the reward and a pardon. Western, with Randolph Scott, Lee Van Cleef, James Best, James Coburn and Pernell Roberts.

programme.title: They Rode West
programme.desc: A cavalry doctor is determined to help deal with a malaria epidemic on a Kiowa reservation. However, his fellow soldiers disapprove of his compassionate attitude, while the tribes medicine man resents outside interference. When the Native Americans attack the fort, the medic is branded a traitor. Western, starring Robert Francis, Donna Reed, May Wynn and Phil Carey

programme.title: Yesterdays Enemy
programme.desc: A British officer leading a patrol through the Burmese jungle during the Second World War uses brutal methods to gain vital intelligence from prisoners, to the outrage of a chaplain and war correspondent travelling with them. When the unit is captured by Japanese forces, he faces similar treatment at the hands of his captors. Drama, starring Stanley Baker, Guy Rolfe and Leo McKern.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: A widowed father is coping badly with his wifes death, but his son is convinced that what he really needs is some new romance in his life. He arranges for his dad to go on a radio phone-in show, and his touching story moves a reporter to respond, even though she is already engaged. She returns to her fiance, but the boy, certain she is the woman for his father, plots to bring them together. Romantic comedy, with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Ticket to Paradise
programme.desc: Divorced couple David and Georgia fake civility for the sake of their daughter, Lily. During a post-graduation trip to Bali, Lily falls in love with a handsome local called Gede, and the young couple hastily decide to marry. With four days until the nuptials, David and Georgia secretly agree a truce to carry out an underhand plan to break up the couple so Lily doesnt make the same mistake as them. Director Ol Parkers comedy romance, starring George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Kaitlyn Dever

programme.title: Baby Ruby
programme.desc: A successful lifestyle entrepreneur is happily pregnant, awaiting the arrival of her first child. But soon after the birth, something starts to feel off, while seemingly perfect neighbourhood mothers become desperate to befriend her. She is plunged into a waking fever dream where everyone is a threat and nothing is as it seems. Psychological horror, starring Noemie Merlant and Kit Harington

programme.title: The Winter Guest
programme.desc: Recent widow Frances is determined to leave her Scotland home for Australia, but receives an unexpected visit from her mother, who is intent on changing her mind. Meanwhile, Frances son faces the prospect of his first sexual experience. Drama, directed by Alan Rickman, and starring Emma Thompson opposite her real-life mother Phyllida Law

programme.title: Hangmans Knot
programme.desc: Confederate soldiers wipe out a group of Union troops carrying a shipment of gold, but later learn the Civil War ended the month before, rendering their attack a criminal act. The soldiers go on the run with the loot, but their worries deepen when they are besieged by bandits. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Donna Reed, Lee Marvin and Richard Denning.

programme.title: The Iron Petticoat
programme.desc: A female Russian pilot defects to the West due to anger at sexual discrimination in the Soviet Air Force. A US Air Force officer tries to convince the committed communist of the benefits of life in the West and romance blossoms - but the KGB are soon stalking the couple. Comedy, starring Bob Hope, Katharine Hepburn, James Robertson Justice and Robert Helpmann

programme.title: Hell Is a City
programme.desc: A tough criminal escapes from jail and hatches a scheme to rob a wealthy bookie, little realising a hardened copper is hot on his trail. Thriller, starring Stanley Baker, John Crawford, Donald Pleasence and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: Outlaw Robin Hood returns to England after the Crusades and goes in search of his beloved Marian, who is now an abbess, and crosses swords once again with old enemy the Sheriff of Nottingham. Medieval adventure, starring Sean Connery, Audrey Hepburn, Robert Shaw, Nicol Williamson, Ronnie Barker, Denholm Elliott and Richard Harris

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: Open Range
programme.desc: Two cattle drovers and their hired hands are looking for pasture to graze their herd, but as they pass through a backwoods town, thugs in the pay of the local sheriff try to drive them from the area. Behind the threats is a land-hungry cattle baron, but the drovers stand their ground as the rancher resorts to increasingly brutal means to intimidate them. Western, directed by and starring Kevin Costner. With Robert Duvall, Annette Bening and Michael Gambon

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: Bomber commander Buzz Rickson is respected by his crew for his daredevil abilities in the air, but his personal life is a disaster. His co-pilot initially idolises the fearless airman, but over time becomes increasingly aware of his heros flaws - especially when Rickson starts pursuing his comrades girlfriend. Second World War drama, starring Steve McQueen, Robert Wagner and Shirley Anne Field.

The presence of an unhappy celebrity causes a paparazzi furore, and nearly costs Frankie his job. Dr Weatherill deals with an uncooperative alcoholic on her first day back at work. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The aftermath of the fire has the Sugden family in turmoil with Andy and Victorias futures still hanging in the balance. Perdy and Gray argue about moving to America.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gray confides in Katie about moving to America and is taken aback when she makes him a shocking offer. The village is still rife with gossip after the Sugdens fire.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Derek threatens to tell Vernon the truth unless Liz agrees to carry on their affair. Claire and Ashley return to the Street, while Tyrone remains uneasy about Pauls presence.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ashley is horrified when Claire goes missing ahead of Freddies birthday party, while Liz grows concerned about Vernons whereabouts. Liam confronts Carla over Joannes sacking.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa worries Dr Timoneys suggestion that she and Martin arent meant to be together might have prompted him to leave Portwenn for good. Calling on Ruth, Morwenna and Janice for help, she tries to track the down the missing GP, with no luck. However, what Dr Ellinghams friends and family fail to realise is that he is actually trapped up at the Winton farm, where desperate wife Annie is trying to coerce him into performing a life-saving operation on her terminally ill husband Jim. Meanwhile, Ruth and Bert seek out Al to offer him a proposition regarding the whisky and the BandB. Medical drama, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Goodwin and Makori work through the night to save a toddler diagnosed with meningitis, while a dying mother worries that her alcoholic husband will not be able to care for their children after she is gone. Meanwhile, Nkeshis future may be decided by a job offer in Cameroon

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike faces a stressful time as he struggles to cope with his wifes departure, and Tricia offers him a shoulder to cry on, but is beset by problems of her own after prescribing birth control to a 16-year-old. Meanwhile, Sergeant Craddock finds his efforts to prepare for an important visit hampered by a series of attacks on the station, and Vernon makes a startling discovery in his bathtub. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Part two of two. Carl Lomaxs case comes to court, and a local reporter soon rakes up the dirt over Tricias controversial decision to supply his girlfriend with birth-control drugs. Before long, he escapes from custody and goes on the run with Deborah. Meanwhile, Vernon invests in a new money-making scheme

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Perdy and Gray discuss Katies offer, but Chas tries to warn the girl that her crush may be affecting her judgement. Zak and Lisa discover Sam is planning on leaving home.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val lures Pollard to the countryside to exact her revenge on him for lying about being paralysed, and Chas begs Katie to withdraw her offer to Perdy and Gray.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: An unforgiving Vernon snubs Lizs efforts to make amends, while Ashley is stunned to see Casey on his doorstep asking to speak to Claire. Liam offers to give Joanne her job back.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tyrone shares his suspicions about Paul with Molly, while Carla pulls rank over Liam at the factory. Claire decides to return to Yvonnes, where Casey pays her a visit.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tempers fray as a kind gesture by Isobel backfires, while Mary fights Bransons corner when his decisions are put under scrutiny. Robert and Coras relationship is under pressure, but can Violet make them see things differently? Bates goes to extreme lengths as his chance of freedom slips away. Costume drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Hugh Bonneville and Elizabeth McGovern

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Portwenn is abuzz with activity for the preparation of Janice and Penhales wedding, but a medical issue could prevent Penhale from making it down the aisle. Meanwhile, Al is struggling with the demands of being best man, especially when Berts marketing antics mean there is only whisky available at the pre-wedding party. Martin Clunes and John Marquez star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Aidensfield residents are shocked when an MI5 agent turns up in the village showing more than just a passing interest in the activities of Vernon Scripps and his mysterious associate, a man who disembarked from a Russian trawler docked in Whitby harbour. It seems there is an even darker side to the roguish wheeler-dealer than they suspected

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordlys staff come under suspicion when some African carvings are stolen from the hall - but then an African chieftain arrives claiming the very same pieces belong to his tribe. Vernon sees a business opportunity that needs the royal stamp of approval and probationary PC Tom Nicholson turns up at the station. Nostalgic drama, starring Jason Durr, Rupert Vansittart and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a woman is drowned in a bath and made to look like a bride, with a chilling lipstick message on the bathroom mirror, it triggers a spate of ghoulish wedding-themed murders in Great Worthy. The case takes Barnaby and Jones to a donkey sanctuary, a heritage steam railway and a pub run by an ex-policeman and former brothel madam as they try to identify the killer. Guest starring Pam Ferris (Rosemary and Thyme) and Kacey Ainsworth (formerly EastEnders Little Mo)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A serial killer begins targeting members of a religious group that claims to provide guidance for lost souls. As the investigation proceeds, it becomes clear that Hathaway, who once trained for the priesthood, knows more about the case than he is willing to reveal - causing Lewis to consider him as a suspect. Guest starring Ian McNeice and Rachael Stirling alongside Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: The murder of two youngsters in ritual slayings lead the police into a case of black magic - and things soon become more incredible, from animal sacrifices and paintings in blood to two of the team apparently cursed by voodoo dolls. Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killers next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib

programme.title: Sailing The Shipping Forecast With the Rev Richard Coles
programme.desc: Writer, radio presenter and musician the Rev Richard Coles marks 100 years of the shipping forecast by travelling round the coasts of the UK and meeting people on and offshore whose lives depend on the weather and sea. He starts his journey sampling the good life in Lundy before finding his sea legs with a Port Isaac fisherman. In Wales, he discovers unique lamb farmed on a saltmarsh and relives his childhood years at the seaside. programme.desc: The team investigates Trues Yard Fisherfolk Museum, where there have been reports of ghostly sightings, strange noises and a violent child spirit

programme.title: Help! My House Is Haunted

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Drew Pritchard visits a sprawling salvage yard that yields many unique items. Next, at an auction house, he faces off against other dealers in a bidding war

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: After years living in London, graphic designer Emma and PR consultant Jason want to up sticks and start a new life on the Kent coast with their two teenage boys

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping Feature. Your one-stop-shop for all things cruise; bringing you the hottest destinations, ground-breaking ships and the latest deals to ensure your next cruise is your greatest one

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a country house sale in Norfolk, and in Glasgow finds a unique tartan piece at a classic tailors. Plus, he finds his oddest buy ever in Liverpool

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Lambretta Scooter Museum in Weston-super-Mare, and in Walsall, West Midlands, there is a historic haul in one of the UKs last leather factories

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard goes on a trip to Jersey where he meets the islands biggest hoarder, and at an old manor house, he discovers an estate-made 1950s swing and trapeze

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson goes property hunting in rural Wiltshire with a couple who have £950,000 to buy a family home with land, where they and their young children can enjoy a self-sufficient lifestyle. Jules also takes time out to find out about the countys glove-making heritage and sees some famous examples made for famous figures

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson assists a Herefordshire couple searching for a character property big enough to use as their home and also to run as a BandB. Martin and Anne are looking for at least three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a separate dining area for guests and a garden where they can have their own vegetable plot

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Drew Pritchard uncovers a marble table lamp and a painting of a mackerel. Later, hes thrilled to look around a stately home in Bedfordshire

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph restores six chairs, and gives a broken wall clock to upcycler Tristan Merriam and a collection of drawers to carpenter Tibby Singh, hoping they can all turn a profit

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts Roo Irvine and Mark Hill continue their Scottish jaunt as a 1970s Triumph transports the duo to shops scattered throughout the Highlands. A Georgian silver brooch gives veteran Tripper Roo something solemn to think about, but a rather unorthodox key rack, she hopes, will unlock some big profits. Meanwhile, rookie Tripper Mark continues to buy like an old hand as he finds a wooden sculpture of a naked torso that makes for an exhilarating auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Roo Irvine and Mark Hill scour the Highlands and Islands for antiques, visiting northerly village John OGroats. A leather case hides a secret and reveals a profit, for one expert, and some 1950s fun excites the other

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus clears a garage packed to the brim with rare antiques. Later, he meets a woman and her collection of valuable ceramic horses

programme.title: The Yorkshire Auction House
programme.desc: Angus uncovers a rare coin collection and some vintage hair cutting gear. An old sea chest proves to be a treasure trove at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Serhat Ahmet tour East Anglia hunting for antiques. As their quest continues, Serhat meets the great nephew of a woman who broke the social norms of the day to go to fight on the front line. Catherine, meanwhile, gets to sample a local delicacy that sounds rather unappealing, but has sustained the local population for centuries. The competing duo then head to a picturesque spot by a windmill to watch their items go under the hammer at auction

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: As their quest for bargains continues, Serhat Ahmet is on the hunt once more for ceramics, while Catherine Southon has her eye on a more eclectic mix of items. Serhat makes some new four-legged friends and finds out about a refugee fleeing his war-torn country who became a local legend in his adopted home town thanks to his crazy stunts and feats of strength. Catherine also gets a taste of a high-speed motorsport and goes for a ride from which she might never recover

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell return with more stories of people who were abandoned as babies, helping them try to find their birth families and know their identities. For a man left as a baby on church steps more than 50 years ago, there are shocking revelations when a long-held family secret is finally uncovered, while a young woman who was discovered in hospital toilets in the 1980s receives some surprising news that deepens the mystery of her beginnings

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present the stories of people searching for siblings. Steve Austin and Moira Tonge only found each other as adults, but then at their mothers funeral discovered they also had an older sister. Lisa Irvine also only found out about her brother Nicholas as an adult, when she read her adoption paperwork and wants to know what happened to him and her birth mother

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell present two more stories, with Louise Stoppani looking for the father she never knew, having discovered aged seven that the man bringing her up was not her biological dad. Jonathan Gaskarth was adopted at six weeks old, but it was only following the breakdown of his marriage that he decided to try to locate his birth parents

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Diesel is a hearing dog for his teenage owner, Rayane, who is deaf. This means he doesnt hear everything. Diesel is trained to listen out for important sounds that Rayane might miss. Diesel is Rayanes ears. Together, theyre unstoppable! Diesel and Rayane are off to the park, where their football team are doing a sponsored fun run to raise the funds for a new kit. Diesel has a busy day ahead. First, he has to filter out all the sounds in the busy park to help Rayane find his friends Grace and Karim and the rest of his teammates at the start line. Then, he has to listen for the klaxon so he can let Rayane know the race is starting. He doesnt want him to get left behind! Rayanes football coach uses British Sign Language to communicate the rules of the race to the runners before they set off. Diesel has to run alongside Rayane and alert him to any danger or to anyone trying to get past. Karim is leading the field until he takes a wrong turn - and Rayane and Diesel set off in hot pursuit. Can they catch their friend and help him finish the race?

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Kika is a golden labrador and a guide dog for her owner Dr Amit, who is blind, which means he cannot see. She is trained to use her super sight to help Dr Amit do as many things as he can by himself. Together, they make the best team! Dr Amit is off to the florists to buy some flowers for his wife, Seema. To help him get there, Kika enlists the help of top secret bumpy bits, the system of clever dots and lines on the pavement that humans call tactile paving. As they navigate their way over a zebra crossing, along a footpath next to a cycle lane, down a stairway near the station and across the road at a pelican crossing, with its top secret spinning cone, Kika explains how the different bumpy bits help her and Dr Amit find their way around town. Its like reading a secret code. Dr Amit wears shoes that he can feel the different bumps through. And when he finds shoes that are good for the bumps, he buys five pairs! But on their way back from the florists, Kika finds their path blocked. Can she use her super sight find a new way home in time to give Seema her flowers?

programme.title: Secret Life of Boys
programme.desc: Granny Bob arrives on her motorbike, declaring she will whip the kids into shape

programme.title: Storybud

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam joins a mail-order music club, aiming to assemble an enviable cassette tape collection. He takes advantage of the 12 tapes for a penny promotion by opening multiple accounts with the club using fake names to get as much music as possible, but has no intention of continuing the monthly contracts. However, when Beverly discovers the scam she blames Erica. Barry asks Murray for help when he realises Laineys dad Bill doesnt like him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As part of the relationship agreement, Sheldon reluctantly has to take care of Amy when she gets sick, but she loves the extra attention so much she pretends to remain in poor health. Elsewhere, Howard tries to get some tips on manliness from Penny when he and Bernadette go to visit her father

programme.title: Neighbours

programme.title: Son of a Critch

programme.title: Tarrac na Farraige
programme.desc: Focusing on the fishing industry in Ireland, as workers grapple with a fragile industry on the cusp of seismic change. Cameras follow Skippers, the men behind the boats, visiting their home ports along Irelands coastline. Though the fishing community is scattered across distant harbours and remote shores, it is bound together by a deep sense of solidarity and an enduring love for the sea

programme.title: Hothouse Flowers - Stick around and laugh a while
programme.desc: A look back at the band in 1988, and their sold-out UK tour in 2023, while investigating why and how the group still stays together. The film explores the bands earliest incarnation at a school talent show, their debut album, and their gig in the RDS in Dublin with an audience of over 40,000 people

programme.title: Am I Being Unreasonable?

programme.title: Lioness

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: A gangster named Bumpy Johnson makes his way in Harlem during the 1960s. A TV prequel to the 2007 film, American Gangster, which centered on the criminal enterprise of Frank Lucas. Drama, starring Forest Whitaker

programme.title: The Sex Lives of College Girls
programme.desc: US comedy series following four room-mates navigating through their new-found freedom on a prestigious campus of Essex College. Kimberly is determined to mend her friendship with Whitney as their second year begins, Bela attempts to change her ways with a new opportunity and Alicia drops a bombshell on Leighton

programme.title: The Sex Lives of College Girls
programme.desc: Now that theyre reunited, Kimberly tries to suss out if a guy who works in the housing office is into her. Whitneys desire to stay focused on herself is challenged by a hot new classmate and Leighton thinks about her future

programme.title: First Dates Hotel
programme.desc: Self-made millionaire Delia is looking for a man to build a future with - could City trader Mark be the one? Kathryn also speaks to experts in the fields of obesity, neuroscience and ultra-processed food marketing

programme.title: Boardwalk Empire
programme.desc: Agent Knox tells Eli that if he doesnt start cooperating, Willie will go to jail, while Sally spots Lucky, Petrucelli and Lansky stashing heroin in with the rum shipments heading north and reports the bad news to Nucky. programme.desc: Pembleton and Lewis are assigned to the murder of a wealthy woman. programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: When a police officer is found shot dead, Elizabeth Wu writes an article praising his dedication to the job, only for an informer to call her with a contradiction - the cop was targeted when he demanded his money back in a dope deal. Meanwhile, Kellermans rogue brothers show up and he winds up in a jail cell with them

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Arya continues her training at the House of Black and White, Jorah and Tyrion run into slavers and the Sand Snakes mount an attack. Fantasy, starring Peter Dinklage

Guest starring Louis Gossett Jr

programme.desc: Varys betrays his queen, and Daenerys brings her forces to Kings Landing as the explosive final battle for the Iron Throne begins. Starring Emilia Clarke, Kit Harington and Peter Dinklage

programme.title: In Treatment
programme.desc: Paul attends the funeral of one of his patients, accompanied by Laura, whose presence causes a stir

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: Pat Seddon considers selling up and visits a clairvoyant, while celebrity chef Mitch Tonks makes an appearance at Brixhams Crab Festival

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: Man of Steel
programme.desc: With the imminent destruction of their home planet approaching, a man and his wife seek to preserve their race by sending their infant son to Earth. The childs spacecraft lands at the farm of Jonathan and Martha Kent, who name him Clark and raise him as their own son. Though his extraordinary abilities have led to the adult Clark living on the fringe of society, he is forced to take a stand to protect his adopted home from a fanatical general from his own world, who intends to wipe out the human race. Sci-fi adventure based on the Superman comic-books, starring Henry Cavill, Amy Adams, Michael Shannon and Russell Crowe

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlins thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: A man living in a bleak future years after a nuclear war has fake memories of being a secret agent implanted into his brain. However, the procedure uncovers the fact that he really is a spy with his memory erased, and he is forced to become a fugitive from the totalitarian government. Sci-fi thriller remake, with Colin Farrell, Kate Beckinsale and Jessica Biel

programme.title: Venom: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Journalist Eddie Brock and symbiote partner-in-crime Venom are lying low in Mexico City, on the run for the apparent murder of detective Patrick Mulligan. The cop and his bonded entity, Toxin, are actually alive at the Imperium symbiote containment programme, beneath the Area 51 US Air Force facility in the Nevada desert. Knull, the symbiotes immortal creator, dispatches hunters to locate Venoms hidden power source, the Codex, which can set Knull free to terrorise the multiverse. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Stephen Graham and Juno Temple

programme.title: The Scorpion King
programme.desc: A ruthless warlord resolves to rid the desert of its few remaining tribes, prompting them to seek the help of a legendary assassin to end the despots reign of terror by destroying his source of power - a beautiful but deadly sorceress. Fantasy action adventure, starring Dwayne Johnson, Steven Brand, Kelly Hu and Michael Clarke Duncan

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Supermans home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

Leonidas, fearless king of Sparta, leads 300 of his finest warriors into battle against the vast invading armies of the ruler of the Persian empire. As the outnumbered Spartans fight for their country, his queen, Gorgo, tries to rally support for her husband at home. Fantasy action adventure based on Frank Miller and Lynn Varleys comic-book series, starring Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, Dominic West, David Wenham and Rodrigo Santoro

programme.title: Superman IV: The Quest for Peace
programme.desc: The Man of Steel embarks on a mission to destroy every nuclear weapon on the planet. However, his arch-enemy Lex Luthor sees the chance to rid himself of the superhero by creating a deadly radioactive henchman who causes havoc around the world. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Mark Pillow and Margot Kidder

programme.title: The Dark Tower
programme.desc: A young lad is transported to a parallel universe where he is caught in a battle between a mysterious gunslinger and a sinister sorcerer. Fantasy adventure based on the Stephen King novels, starring Idris Elba, Matthew McConaughey and Tom Taylor

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlins thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr

programme.title: The Green Hornet
programme.desc: A wealthy playboy inherits a media empire when his father dies. Determined to do some good for a change, he uses his new-found fortune to become a masked crime-fighter. Aided by his chauffeur, who is a kung fu expert and a technical genius, he fights to bring down a powerful gangster. Comic-book adventure, starring Seth Rogen, Jay Chou, Cameron Diaz and Christoph Waltz

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogram the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel

Leonidas, fearless king of Sparta, leads 300 of his finest warriors into battle against the vast invading armies of the ruler of the Persian empire. As the outnumbered Spartans fight for their country, his queen, Gorgo, tries to rally support for her husband at home. Fantasy action adventure based on Frank Miller and Lynn Varleys comic-book series, starring Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, Dominic West, David Wenham and Rodrigo Santoro

programme.title: William Tell
programme.desc: During the 14th century, William Tell defends his family and his homeland of Switzerland after the Austrian King invades. Historical drama, starring Claes Bang, Connor Swindells, Ben Kingsley and Jonathan Pryce

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Maverick film-maker Carl Denham and his cast and crew board a ship bound for a mysterious island - but when they arrive, a giant gorilla carries off their leading lady, Ann Darrow. As the crew makes its way through the teeming jungle to find her, the director concocts a dangerous scheme to capture the great ape and take it back to New York. Peter Jacksons remake of the fantasy adventure, starring Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody and Andy Serkis, in a dual role as the ships cook and motion-captured creature

programme.title: Twisters
programme.desc: Meteorologist Kate Cooper crosses paths with social media star Tyler Owens. He recklessly chases storms with his crew and gleefully posts their daredevil exploits, as multiple storm systems converge over central Oklahoma. Standalone disaster sequel, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones and Glen Powell

programme.title: Mad Max: Fury Road
programme.desc: A drifter in a post-apocalyptic wasteland encounters a crazed, sadistic warlord and his radiation-afflicted cult. He assists a warrior who has turned against the tyrant, and liberates five women who have been forced to become his brides. Together, they make a desperate journey through the desert to salvation, with their enemies in hot pursuit. Reboot of the sci-fi thriller franchise, starring Tom Hardy and Charlize Theron

programme.title: Superman Returns
programme.desc: The Man of Steel returns to Earth after an absence of several years to find his lost love Lois Lane has moved on with her life. Meanwhile, arch-villain Lex Luthor is out of jail and about to wreak havoc on the world with technology stolen from Supermans home planet of Krypton. Comic-book adventure from X-Men director Bryan Singer, with Brandon Routh, Kevin Spacey, Kate Bosworth and Parker Posey

programme.title: Chappie
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks kidnap the inventor of a highly intelligent law-enforcement robot. They force him to reprogram the android so it will help them carry out an audacious heist worth $200million, but in doing so, incur the wrath of a ruthless and corrupt general. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sharlto Copley, Hugh Jackman and Dev Patel

programme.title: The Wild Thornberrys Movie
programme.desc: The animal-loving family heads for Africa, where Eliza discovers unscrupulous poachers are plotting to kill an entire herd of elephants with the aid of a deadly electric fence, leaving her and ever-present pal Darwin to save the day. Animated adventure, with the voices of Lacey Chabert, Tim Curry, Tom Kane, Cree Summer, Lynn Redgrave and Jodi Carlisle

programme.title: Dragon Rider
programme.desc: A silver dragon named Firedrake and his friends search for a mythical safe haven hidden in the Himalayas. Animated family adventure based on the novel by Cornelia Funke, featuring the voices of Felicity Jones, Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Patrick Stewart and Freddie Highmore

programme.title: Barnyard
programme.desc: A fun-loving male cow who spends his time hanging out with his friends and partying all night is forced to accept responsibility for the first time in his life, after being placed in charge of the farmyard following the untimely demise of his father. Animated comedy, with the voices of Kevin James, Courteney Cox, Sam Elliott, Danny Glover and Andie MacDowell

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family is cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: Anxiety-crippled mallard Mack spins nightmarish bedtime stories to educate his children, Dax and Gwen, about the perils of straying from the comfort of Moose Head Pond. Eventually Mack organises a spontaneous family migration south from leafy New England to Jamaica, accompanied by curmudgeonly uncle Dan. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Kumail Nanjiani, Elizabeth Banks, Danny DeVito and Carol Kane

programme.title: Turbo
programme.desc: A garden snail obsessed with motor racing gets sucked into a cars exhaust pipe, and emerges having gained super-speed. This stroke of luck allows him to realise his dream of competing against human drivers in the prestigious Indianapolis 500 race. Animated adventure, with the voices of Ryan Reynolds, Paul Giamatti and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: Dracula is worried that his half-human grandson is not showing any vampiric tendencies, so enlists the help of his fellow monsters in showing the youngster how it is done. The count is shocked to receive an unwelcome visit from his own father, who does not approve of his sons tolerance of humans. Animated comedy, with the voices of Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda 2
programme.desc: Martial arts master panda Po continues to hone his skills when an evil peacock, who was banished from China for trying to build a deadly new weapon, returns to cause more chaos. It falls to Po to defeat him, but he suffers strange flashbacks revealing a connection between his past and the sinister bird. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Jack Black and Gary Oldman

programme.title: Over the Hedge
programme.desc: A raccoon trickster is fretting about his debt to a fearsome bear when he stumbles on some animals waking in the woods after their winter nap. Spotting the chance to solve his problem, the raccoon dupes the gullible creatures into stealing food from a nearby suburb so he can give it to the bear - but they fail to realise they will soon be at the mercy of a vermin exterminator. Animated comedy, with the voices of Bruce Willis, Steve Carell, Garry Shandling and William Shatner

programme.title: Sing
programme.desc: In a city of humanoid animals, a hustling koalas attempt to save his theatre with a singing competition becomes grander than he anticipates, while the finalists of the contest find that their lives will never be the same again. Animated comedy, with the voices of Matthew McConaughey, Reese Witherspoon, Seth MacFarlane, Scarlett Johansson, John C Reilly, Taron Egerton, Jennifer Saunders and Jennifer Hudson

programme.title: Migration
programme.desc: Anxiety-crippled mallard Mack spins nightmarish bedtime stories to educate his children, Dax and Gwen, about the perils of straying from the comfort of Moose Head Pond. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Kumail Nanjiani, Elizabeth Banks, Danny DeVito and Carol Kane

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Animal Instincts
programme.desc: The dark knight joins forces with a team of superheroes including Green Arrow and The Flash to battle the mastermind behind a horse of deadly robotic animals. Animated superhero adventure, with the voices of Roger Craig Smith and Chris Diamantopoulos

programme.title: The Inventor
programme.desc: Leonardo Da Vinci explores the meaning of life with the help of a French princess. Stop-motion animated adventure, with the voices of Daisy Ridley, Marion Cotillard, Matt Berry and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Batman Unlimited: Mechs vs Mutants
programme.desc: The Dark Knight battles old enemies who have been transformed into giant monsters. Animated superhero adventure, with the voices of Roger Craig Smith and Oded Fehr
